description:
Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is just a few days away from launch, and Bethesda has now revealed the game's PC specs ahead of the game's December 6 early access period and December 9 launch.

The game is also launching on Xbox Series X, but naturally, PC players will want to make sure their machines are capable of running the game before purchasing it. Keep reading for a closer look at Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's PC specs.
title: Will Indiana Jones And The Great Circle Run On Your PC? Check Out The Requirements
Alien: Romulus 4K Steelbook Has 2-Month Wait At Amazon, Available To Ship Now From Walmart

description:
Demon Slayer's Swordsmith Village Arc is now available on Blu-ray, and you can save on the three-disc Blu-ray release at Amazon on launch day (December 3). Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba: Swordsmith Village Arc is up for grabs for $51 at Amazon, which is more than 25% off its $70 list price.

While you're picking up the Swordsmith Village Arc, you can round out your collection by saving big on prior seasons of Demon Slayer at Amazon. Select Cyber Monday Blu-ray deals are still available (for now), but there's no telling when these will disappear:

  • Demon Slayer Season 1: Part 1 (Episodes 1-13) -- $34 ($65)
  • Demon Slayer Seas
title: Demon Slayer Blu-Rays Steeply Discounted At Amazon - Swordsmith Village Arc Launched Today
This Ginormous Sleeping Kirby Plush Is Available For Preorder, But Stocks Are Limited

description:
Over the last decade, streamers have taken on greater prominence in the gaming landscape and some have even attracted significant fan followings. Now, a new report suggests that players are spending more time watching gaming videos than they are actually playing the games themselves. And it may represent an opportunity for video game publishers to add more revenue from the hardcore fans.

Midia Research has released a 17-page report detailing the time that players of various age groups spend playing games and watching game-related videos. The consumer survey was conducted in the second quarter of 2024 and featured responses from players in the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, Canada, Germany, France, Sweden, South Korea, and Brazil. According to the report, the total average time that players devote to their hobby is approximately just under
title: Gamers May Spend More Time Watching Games Than Playing Them
Best Launch Deals On The New Disney+ Star Wars And Marvel 4K Blu-Ray Collector's Editions

description: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has enjoyed a positive reception since its launch in October, due in no small part to the amount of high-quality content regularly being added to the game. Its latest update includes a holiday-themed Nuketown map makeover and a "stoner DLC" is confirmed to be in the pipeline, to name just a few of the game's entertaining new features. But Activision also
title: Free Black Ops 6 Gameplay Trial Is Coming This Month, Provides Access To Zombies And Multiplayer

description:
Longtime PlayStation boss Shawn Layden left the company in 2019, and he recently gave an interview about the PlayStation's 30th anniversary. In that interview he touched on a great number of topics, and he also revealed the one classic PlayStation franchise he'd like to see Sony return to one day.

Layden told Eurogamer that he would like to see the MediEvil series make a comeback for modern audiences. He said the game spoke to him the first time he saw it and he was a big fan of the team behind it, so much so that he helped get a sequel out the door and eventually a remaster on PS4.

"I would love another whack at MediEvil," he said.
title: Former PlayStation Boss Reveals The One Classic Sony Franchise He Wants To See Return

description:
While everyone is waiting for a new Grand Theft Auto 6 trailer, Rockstar Games has gone ahead and unveiled the next expansion for Grand Theft Auto Online. Starting on December 10, players will be able to start Agents of Sabotage, a new story that introduces a renegade ex-Federal Investigation Bureau agent who is all too happy to help set up some high-stakes robberies. The first trailer for expansion sets the tone for everything to come.

The name of the rogue FIB operative is Jod
title: GTA Online Debuts Trailer And Release Date For Next Expansion

description:
Activision has announced what's coming to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone for the holiday season, and while there are plenty of festive updates planned, one store bundle in particular stands out.

The "Dank Days" Tracer Pack is themed around one of Call of Duty's most enduringly popular activities: smoking pot. The bundle invites players to "coast through the holiday season" with plenty of weed-themed items, including the "Bongshot" Mastercraft blueprint for the KSV SMG. Intriguingly, Activision said the visual effects of this weapon "intensify" with successive kills. No footage has been released so far, but it seems like this could be in reference to some kind of "trippy" visual effects.

Also in the bundle is the "Blunty" operator skin, which turns your character into some kind of lizard. Then there's
title: Call Of Duty's Best Stoner DLC Yet Turns You Into A Pot-Smoking Lizard

description:
Just a couple of days away from launch, preloading is now available for Infinity Nikki on PS5, Epic Games Store, and mobile platforms. Developer Infold Games has also announced new rewards for players when they start their adventure in the open-world fashion title, such as a special stylist background and two four-star outfits.

In addition, a new release trailer--seen below--sets up the plot for the stylist's adventure in Infinity Nikki. Apparently, wishes used to flourish in Miraland, but after a thousand years, they now just lead to despair. Nikki has the ability to heal the world, along with her cute companion, Momo.
title: You Can Preload Infinity Nikki Now, As Cozy Game Gets New Launch Trailer

description:
Season 1 Reloaded arrives in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone on December 5, bringing plenty of midseason content. This includes the brand-new Citadelle des Morts Zombies map, Warzone Ranked Play, three new DLC weapons, holiday events across all modes, and more.

All of the highlighted content for Season 1 Reloaded can be seen below, including looks at all the new maps, holiday variants, and DLC weapons, as well as the wild-looking store bundles.

Activision has revealed the full gameplay and
title: CoD: Black Ops 6 And Warzone Season 1 Reloaded Includes Holiday Events, Snowball Fights, And New Zombies Map

description: Amazon has revealed all the PC games that'll be available this month through its Prime Gaming service, and in total, you can look forward to 18 games in December. The first batch of games are now available, and these include a mix of classic Star Wars, Tomb Raider adventures, and one of last year's breakout hits. As a reminder, once you claim the free games from Prime Gaming, they are yours to keep forever--even if your subscription expires. If you aren't a member, you can sign up for Amazon Prime for as little as one month to take advantage of the subscription and score some great freebies.
title: Amazon Prime Members Get These 18 Free Games In December

description:
The Citadelle des Morts Zombies map arrives in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 on December 5, and Activision has released a full gameplay trailer to show off the new map and features. This includes the map's unique Wonder Weapons and elite enemy type called the Doppelghast.

The setting of Citadelle des Morts is a castle in France, and as the developers previously revealed, the map contains a big focus on magic. The unique Wonder Weapons for the map are four elemental swords, taking inspiration from popular maps of the past, with elemental staffs featured in Origins and bows for Der Eisendrache.

The new gameplay trailer shows off some of the interior and exterior parts of the castle setting, with the cast of characters fighting off hord
title: CoD: Black Ops 6 Zombies Gameplay Trailer Shows Off Elemental Swords And Terrifying New Enemy

description:
In the often grey and macho world of video games, it's refreshing to see a colourful creation that isn't afraid to shine. Look no further than the latest head-turning adventure from developer Infold Games, Infinity Nikki. Part open-world adventure, part platformer, and all style; Infinity Nikki is an ambitious console and PC follow-up to the previously mobile-only Nikki dress-up titles, led by the ex-director of Breath of The Wild, Kentaro Tominaga.

The result? An engrossing and stylish RPG unlike anything else you've played. As you soar across the sky, battling the Dark Essence, trying on unforgettable magical outfits, and befriending a cast of charming animals and stylists, Infinity Nikki injects the once drab RPG genre with a flamboyant air of kawaii style.

Without further ado then, we invite you to put on your best outfit and join us as we head out on a uniquely fabulous adventure. Before you try Infinity Nikki on for size, however, we've got a handy list of everyt
title: Infinity Nikki - Everything To Know

description:
With Nintendo set to announce the Switch 2, or whatever it's called, in just a few months, at least one retailer has already begun selling alleged accessories for it. There are some major unknowns here and some asterisks to be aware of, however.

Chinese retailer Alibaba is now selling screen protectors for the Switch 2, and these screen protectors are larger than what would be required for the current Switch, which is 7 inches for the OLED edition. A previous leak suggested the Switch 2's screen could be 8 inches. A carrying case bearing the name "Switch 2" is also available to buy on Alibaba, sporting a design that would suggest the Switch 2 will be a similar form factor to the existing model--something that many have theorized already.

Before this, the alleged new Joy-Cons for the Switch 2 leaked,
title: Alleged Switch 2 Accessories Are Now Available To Buy--With A Major Asterisk

description:
Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is aiming to be an authentic recreation of the archeologist's globetrotting adventures, and as you'd expect, solving puzzles is a big part of the game. A key element in the films, developer MachineGames has worked on creating puzzles that'll be challenging but not impossible to solve. For anyone worried about getting stuck in the mandatory puzzle-solving stages, the developer has a novel solution for these sections of the game.

As design director Jens Andersson explained, players can do first-person shooting with Indy's camera to gain hints that'll allow them to complete ancient puzzles. This will be available through the game's "Adventure" difficulty setting, which reduces the challenge of completing these mysteries.
title: Indiana Jones Game Will Let You Shoot Puzzles (With Your Camera) To Solve Them

description:
Buried under Capcom's Osaka, Japan headquarters is a small foley studio. Dozens--if not hundreds--of shoes are tucked into cubbies outside the door. Inside, the space looks more like an antique store than the high-end recording studio responsible for the sound effects from nearly every Capcom game. The walls are adorned with household appliances, fabrics, and tools of every kind. The foley artist that greets us is holding what appears to be a PVC pipe with a mouth piece haphazardly mounted onto the side of it. The team calls this strange gray tube Murmurs of a King; it's an instrument Capcom created specifically for the Rey Dau, a ferocious beast that players will hunt in Monster Hunter Wilds.

Unlike most instruments, Murmurs of a King does not sound pleasant. Its bass-y screeches don't even sound like an imposing monster, at least at first. After recording the instrument a few times, a sound editor goes to work and within minutes they've created a guttural monster
title: Monster Hunter Wilds Doesn't Sacrifice Depth In Streamlining The Experience

description:
More games


The calendar has flipped over to the final month of the year, and Microsoft has now announced the next set of additions to Game Pass for December. This is the first of two expected waves of additions to Game Pass for December, and the first half of the month's biggest launch is, of course, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle (December 9).

Developed by MachineGames, The Great Circle is a single-player, first-person adventure game that takes places between the events of Raiders of the Lost Ark and The Last Crusade, in the year 1937.

PC Game Pass members can take advantage of a
title: Game Pass For December Includes Indiana Jones And Lots More

description:
The calendar has flipped over to December, and while Microsoft isn't ready to reveal all the games headed to Game Pass this month, the company has announced one: Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled. The racing game from Activision hits Game Pass on December 4.

This might not be the only Crash game headed to Game Pass soon, as an Amazon Fire Stick leak suggests Crash Bandicoot 4 is also coming to Game Pass. This is unconfirmed for now, though. Before this, Crash Bandicoot N' Sane Trilogy came to Game Pass this past August.

Start your engines and get ready to race in 3…2…1…
CRASH TEAM RACING NITRO-FUELED IS COMING TO
title: Next Game Pass Release Is A Crash Bandicoot Kart Racer, And That May Not Be All

description:
From Software is not currently considering Elden Ring 2, according to studio boss Hidetaka Miyazaki. He confirmed this during a speech following a recent awards ceremony where the game's Shadow of the Erdtree expansion took home an award.

Asked about the expansion of the Elden Ring franchise, Miyazaki said, as reported by IGN Japan and Automaton, "We're not really considering developments such as an Elden Ring 2."

While there may be no sequel plans currently, Miyazaki said the Elden Ring franchise could return "in some form in the future." Miyazaki previously said people have expressed interest in making an Elden Ring movie, but no such proj
title: Elden Ring 2 Is Not Happening, At Least Not Yet
